page.title: 09Development of the area
page.content: Historically this area was once one of hillforts and iron age settlements but the twentieth century has seen it withdraw into a quiet, very rural "outside of town". The paucity of primary and the absence of secondary schools in the area together with the lack of new housing developments ensure its lasting tranquility. Certain of the roads are notable as old coaching roads with some early eighteenth century housing still in the hands of the same families - namely those on the Hillhall Road. Other settlements like the former villages of Hilden and the Plantation have joined the Lisburn urban sprawl. Current "green belt" planning legislation will protect the rural character of the area.
